## GAD-7 vs HAS

GAD-7 vs HAS Psychologists and researchers often grapple with the challenge of comparing and harmonising various instruments of psychological assessment. A common point of comparison is between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the History & Aetiology Schedule (HAS), so let's look at GAD-7 vs HAS. While GAD-7 focuses on pinpointed questions about personal anxiety symptoms, HAS covers multiple factors such as medical history, alcohol consumption, and life events, amongst others. Comparing items between GAD-7 and HAS manually is arduous, subjective, and significantly time-consuming. However, [Harmony](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) offers a streamlined, technology-powered solution to this problem. Harmony is an innovative tool that uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to harmonise questionnaire items. It can compare items, such as those in GAD-7 vs HAS, giving a percentage match between each item. Moreover, it is capable of dealing with multiple languages which adds an extra layer of convenience and efficiency. With Harmony's smart resource, scientists can make use of their own PDFs of questionnaires by simply dragging and dropping them into Harmony's interactive web interface. Employing Harmony for GAD-7 vs HAS comparison not only simplifies the process but also enhances the possibilities of conducting cross-study comparisons. This supports researchers in conducting longitudinal analysis across various studies, opening avenues for identifying consistencies or differences amidst changing social conditions. So the next time you think about GAD-7 vs HAS, consider Harmony - as it promises accuracy, speed, and utter ease.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and HAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and HAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just HAS into Harmony</a> - compare HAS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
